newsitem.title: JAPAN: Yen slide not cause for immediate worry-MOF quoted.
newsitem.headline: Yen slide not cause for immediate worry-MOF quoted.

text.p: The yen's recent slide against the dollar is not a cause for immediate concern, but should be watched closely, Jiji news agency quoted a senior Japanese Finance Ministry official as saying.
Kosuke Nakahira, a special adviser to the ministry and former vice minister for international affairs, told Jiji that the slide has been fast but foreign exchange markets had not behaved abnormally.

He added that he expected the Group of Seven nations to discuss currency rates at a February 8 meeting in Berlin and that the G7 should be ready to send a signal to markets if speculative moves threatened to undermine economies, Jiji said.
